NealNew York University ArchivesNew York University ArchivesElmer Holmes Bobst Library70 Washington Square South10th FloorNew York, NY 10012(212) 998-2641university-archives@nyu.eduThis finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace 2019-06-24T15:52:53Finding aid written in EnglishDescribing Archives: A Content Standard
New York University Archives
Edmund V. Bragdon Collection
Bragdon, Edmund
MC 329
0.5 Linear Feet in 1 manuscript box
1900-1904 Edmund V. Bragdon, a graduate of New York University (NYU), collected memorabilia related to his time as a student at NYU. Materials include event programs, dance cards, and a photograph of students taken in 1904. Materials primarily in English. Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.
Conditions Governing Access
Access to the Edmund V. Bragdon Collection is restricted until it has been arranged and described by an archivist.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Materials donated by Virginia Bragdon Easton in circa 1997. The accession number associated with this collection is 97.004.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Edmund V. Bragdon Collection; MC 329; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
In 2019 materials were rehoused by Preservation and sent to offsite storage.
Scope and Contents
This collection doucuments Edmund V. Bragdon's time as a student at New York University (NYU). Materials include event programs, dance cards, and a photograph of students taken in 1904.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Memorabilia.
